ygData.messageBody:
From: bonecrkr@...

>> I could use a little advice from any of the GrandMaster Fletchers out
there. I've been working the Fletching skill pretty hard (to quote one of
the guides on fletchin, making arrows until my eyes bleed) and my skill is
now 170.

Great to hear!!!

>> I'm currently making arrows with Large Nocks, Wood Shafts, Field Points
and ceramic vanes. Unfortunately, it is now becoming teminally expensive to
level the skill up (at least with the ceramic vanes). They are not trivial
but are no longer driving my skill up at an acceptable rate. Before I flush
more pp away, could someone with level 200 skill tell me if I should stick
with ceramic vanes (if so, until when) or move on to cheap components with
steel shafts (until when) and then cheap components with blade points.

Keep plugging away, it doesn't get any cheaper......

>> Also, I'd like some info on making the high end bows. For example, is it
safe to start working with Oak yet and at what point am I likely not to cry
from a failure with Darkwood?

Yes it is safe to work with Oak. You are not likely to cry from a failure
on Darkwood, when you can easily pick up 350pp from your bank account and
click destroy.

>> I read somewhere that planing tools and knives add 20 to the skill needed
to make a bow and that cams are for Oak and Darkwood only. Do they add to
the difficulty of making a bow? I notice that, since the patch our
fletching kit has more spots. I take it that we can now make 2 cam bows and
plane them etc. Does this actually work (rather not discover a bug by
investing good pp, hehe)

Probably.... I have no real data on this one...

>> What is a good price to charge for the Oak and Ashwood bows or even the
trueshot if I get my lazy butt up to do the quest.

Ash I sell for 25pp (No tool versions)

Oak I sell for 150 to 175 depending on the tools, and I don't sell Cammed
Oak bows (if I did they would be 250). Trueshot I sell for 300pp, I will
sell it for 200pp if they give me a staff and I don't fail it. I only sell
2 Darkwoods, both with Planing Tool and Silk, the 1-Cam for 600pp and the
2-Cam for 750pp.. I have heard, but not tested, that you cannot double cam
Oak.


Vapn, Master Fletcher, Povar
